results.title: One power alone: William Blake
results.brief_description: The story of William Blake’s life using his poems and his paintings to illustrate the events of his life and the development of his thought. Narrated by William Powell

results.title: One potato, two potato
results.brief_description: The title is a children’s counting out rhyme; the film records London children at play; yet what they do, and how they amuse themselves, and the uncanny skill and lore which they pass on from age to age, make them children playing games in any city.

results.title: One plus one
results.creator_credit: Jean-Luc Godard, Iain Quarrier, Michael Pearson and Cupid Productions Ltd
results.brief_description: In this film Godard appears fascinated less by the Rolling Stones’ rebel-rock image (the Stone-as-product) than he is with their process of composition. Through its hovering concentration, the camera tracking and panning acrosss each member of the band, this emerges as one of the most detailed, revealing rock documentaries ever made. The film is a collage of the Rolling Stones rehearsing the song “Sympathy with the Devil”, Black Power revolutionaries and a TV interview with one Eve Democracy, is a key film from the period following the ‘68 uprising when there was ‘something in the air’ and stands as a model of political film-making during changing times.

results.title: One planet - two worlds: five minutes to midnight
results.creator_credit: World Focus, Alan Hart and Ian McFarlane
results.brief_description: Examines the crisis of world hunger and poverty. Considers the economic division of the world and points out the possibility of a world catastrophe if the division continues unchecked. Stresses the need to launch a global attack on the problem to ensure human survival. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.title_for_label: One planet - two worlds: five minutes to midnight

results.title: One perfect day
results.creator_credit: Lightstream films, Phil Gregory, Paul Currie and Charles Morton
results.brief_description: Follow the journey of music composer Tommy Matisse (Dan Speilman) as he studies music in England - a world away from lover Alysse (Abie Cornish) back in Australia. His creative process is to listen to the sounds around him, make music that moves him and affects others. The bond of music might or might not be strong enough to reunite the two when through family tragedy Tommy returns to Australia. Original music by David Hobson. Debut feature film by director Paul Currie. Cast includes Kerrie Armstrong, Leeanna Walsman, Andrew Howard, Nathan Phillips.

results.title: One people one soul
results.brief_description: The people of Irian Jaya are fighting a little known but bloody war of survival against the government of Indonesia. This program explores what is at stake in this war - a people and their country. The West Papuan people, as they prefer to call themselves, speak from guerilla hideouts in the jungle and from crowded refugee camps in Papua New Guinea.

results.title: One past eight futures "The making of"
results.brief_description: This mini-documentary takes us behind the scenes of the ‘One past eight futures’ Digital Storytelling workshop at ACMI. The participants of this particular workshop are eight young indigenous people who are part of the Indigenous Youth Leadership program. They discuss their stories, their participation in the workshop and what they have gained from the experience. The results are a social and cultural snapshot of Australia’s Indigenous youth, through their stories, their ties to the past and, mostly, their hopes for the future.

results.title: One out of three is a fsihboat
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Andy Thomson, Robert Verrall and Wolf Koenig
results.brief_description: A hard-hitting film suggesting that new attitudes and practices are needed in Canada’s fishing industry to protect the lives and property of those who work at sea. Accidents due to the unsafe condition of boats, bad habits of seamanship, fire or defects in safety equipment can be avoided. A ship safety inspector and instructors at New Brunswick’s School of Fisheries and Newfoundland’s College of Fisheries show where the roots of disaster can lie.
